author: Jim Daly
title: Liverpool Legends pay tribute to Ronnie Moran ahead of friendly clash with Real Madrid
text:
Sport Liverpool Legends pay tribute to Ronnie Moran ahead of friendly clash with Real Madrid The former Liverpool player, captain, coach and caretaker manager passed away on Wednesday morning at the age of 83. Share Get football   
Anfield rose as one to pay tribute to Livepool legend Ronnie Moran on Saturday ahead of a clash with Real Madrid. 
The former Liverpool player, captain, coach and caretaker manager passed away on Wednesday morning at the age of 83. 
He had dedicated half a century of his life to the club. 
Players from a Liverpool Legends team as well as their Real Madrid counterparts paused for a minute before their friendly clash on Saturday to pay tribute to him. 
As did fans an Anfield as everyone got to their feed to applaud an incredibly loyal servant to the club, operating as a player, coach, assistant manager, mentor and Boot Room original over the course of his life. (Photo: Allsport) (Photo: Getty) 
Since he passed away on Tuesday the tributes have been pouring in for the Anfield legend. 
"Very sad news with the passing of Ronnie Moran this morning, a legendary figure @ LFC & learnt me & others an awful lot. R.I.P," Jamie Carragher posted on Twitter. 
Moran's son Paul had earlier written: "I am devastated to tell everyone on behalf of the family that my dad passed away this morning after a short illness." 
Another Reds legend, Robbie Fowler, responded: "So sorry to hear this Paul..Deepest sympathy to you and all the family, thoughts and prayers with you ... The man deserves the legend status." 
Jon Flanagan was the first of the current players to share his thoughts about a man who was so generous with his time. 
"Gutted to hear that Ronnie Moran has passed away. A true footballing man who gave me great advice," he tweeted. 
Jim Beglin described Moran as "the strongest voice in the dressing room" who "improved an awful lot of Liverpool players". 
Phil Thompson said: "So so sorry to hear of the passing of my friend and mentor Ronnie Moran a true LFC great." 
Luia Garcia added: "He was walking around Melwood everyday !! He couldn't be far from the pitch where he belonged." 
"It's a sad end to a great man's life," former Reds manager Roy Evans told BBC Radio Five Live. 
"He's one of these guys that day in, day out, did his job and did a great job for Liverpool Football Club. 
"Liverpool and the fans will remember him for the great man that he was and he'll be sadly missed." 
Liverpool legend Ronnie Moran dies aged 83 (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
Moran made 379 appearances between 1952 and 1968, scoring 17 goals, but arguably played as big a role as part of Bill Shankly's famous Boot Room. 
Having played for the Reds boss he was then invited by the Scot to join the coaching team and Moran twice filled in as caretaker manager during 49 years of service at the club. 
"Liverpool Football Club is deeply saddened by the passing of Ronnie Moran," said a statement from the club. 
A statement from Everton read: "We are deeply saddened at the passing of a Merseyside football great, Ronnie Moran. Our thoughts are with his family and friends." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
